variables.name: mValue
variables.comment:
* The value to be autofilled. Pass {@code null} if you do not have the value
     * but the target view is a logical part of the dataset. For example, if the
     * dataset needs authentication and you have no access to the value.

variables.name: mFilter
variables.comment:
* Regex used to determine if the dataset should be shown in the autofill UI;
     * when {@code null}, it disables filtering on that dataset (this is the recommended
     * approach when {@code value} is not {@code null} and field contains sensitive data
     * such as passwords).
     *
     * @see Dataset.DatasetFieldFilter
     * @hide

variables.name: mPresentations
variables.comment: * The presentations used to visualize this field in Autofill UI.

methods.name: public AutofillValue getValue()
methods.comment:
* The value to be autofilled. Pass {@code null} if you do not have the value
     * but the target view is a logical part of the dataset. For example, if the
     * dataset needs authentication and you have no access to the value.

methods.name: public Dataset.DatasetFieldFilter getDatasetFieldFilter()
methods.comment:
* Regex used to determine if the dataset should be shown in the autofill UI;
     * when {@code null}, it disables filtering on that dataset (this is the recommended
     * approach when {@code value} is not {@code null} and field contains sensitive data
     * such as passwords).
     *
     * @see Dataset.DatasetFieldFilter
     * @hide

methods.name: public Pattern getFilter()
methods.comment:
* Regex used to determine if the dataset should be shown in the autofill UI;
     * when {@code null}, it disables filtering on that dataset (this is the recommended
     * approach when {@code value} is not {@code null} and field contains sensitive data
     * such as passwords).

methods.name: public Presentations getPresentations()
methods.comment: * The presentations used to visualize this field in Autofill UI.
